points: In 2019, Dr. Ahmed Al-Demlawy introduced the foundations of Classificatory Emotional Medicine:
He defined a precise correspondence between tissue functionality and emotional meaning (anatomical mimicry).
Established a tissue color code to explain disturbed emotional patterns (new shock cycle).
Adopted the Luscher color diagnostic test and introduced 'instinct' as a measure of balance and disturbance.
Introduced energy weight of color as a meaningful metric and implemented it in CPC program.
Teaches these techniques globally through the diploma of classificatory medicine.
Introduced Therapy Gym self-healing groups for conditions difficult to treat with conventional medicine.
Applied osteopathy science for emotional diagnostics as a novel contribution.
Developed a gender identity model to define and measure innate emotional traits.
Offers marriage and intimacy counseling with over 40 years of experience.
Studied under elite professors like:
Professor Max Luscher, founder of the emotion-logic color theory.
Dr. Ryke Geerd Hamer, who linked organic symptoms to emotional shocks visible in brain CT scans.
Learned from Stephen Porges' Polyvagal Theory.
Used his medical education and scientific foundations to develop emotional diagnostic tools for healing.
Dr. Ahmed Abdel-Meguid Al-Demlawy was born in Alexandria, Egypt in 1959.
Graduated from Ain Shams University Medical School in 1983.
Studied biomedical engineering at the University of Washington until 1990.
Holds an MBA from ESLSCA Business School in France.
Former Vice President of IMMA and a global MetaHealth trainer and professor.
